FuncDef:
The cpos mix-link-protocol enable command enables coexistence of MP services and any of TDM, ATM, and IMA services on the same subcard.
The undo cpos mix-link-protocol enable command disables coexistence of MP services and any of TDM, ATM, and IMA services on the same subcard.
By default, MP services and any of TDM, ATM, and IMA services cannot coexist.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable the coexistence of MP services and any of TDM, ATM, and IMA services on the same subcard, run the cpos mix-link-protocol enable command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
When you have configured MP services and any of TDM, ATM, and IMA services, if you run the undo cpos mix-link-protocol enable command, an error message is displayed, prompting you to delete the mixed configuration.
After coexistence of MP services and any of TDM, ATM, and IMA services is enabled and the MTU is configured shorter than or equal to 1356 bytes, the MP services and any of TDM, ATM, and IMA services can be both configured. If the MTU is configured longer than 1356 bytes, packet loss may occur.
